info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Catawba, southern Alexander and west central Iredell Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Taylorsville, or 4 miles east of Bethlehem, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Taylorsville, Hickory, St. Stephens, Conover, Bethlehem, Claremont, Catawba, Lookout Shoals Lake and Lake Hickory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
